column2: gpllml, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed this medication for a corneal abrasion. I was told the medication was painful to use and was also given a prescription for percocet which I actually had to use as the pain was so great.

column2: RhondaVI, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After using this medication for pink eye for the last 24 hours, I have not seen any improvement. If anything my eyes feel more irritated than they did before I started the treatment. I had pink eye once before and was prescribed Bleph which worked really well.

column9: Entire face swollen after using this product prescribed by Dr. who did eyelid rejuvenation.  Allergic reaction.  I'm also allergic to neosporin.  Do these two have a similar ingredient that I should be aware of?

column1: Bacterial Inflammation of Cornea and Covering of Eye
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Erythromycin 5 MG Eye Ointment was prescribed for 2 corneal abrasions.  The pain ceased within 48 hours. My vision is rapidly improving daily.

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It's been 24hrs since I have started to use it. It's cleared the infection up a little but my face is swelled up.

column2: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Not sure about the effectiveness, I'm taking it along with oral antibiotics. I've got a chalazion and with this, the other medicine and warm compress they've gone away in about a week. I had just been washing my eye carefully and had the bump for several months. I also had to have one lanced which is why I'm on the oral medication as well.  I'm satisfied with the Doctor's prescription.

column2: 0-2 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: This was perscribed to us for our 2 year old's case of pink-eye she caught at daycare.  It was extremely effective at curing her infection, however application of a thick gel to a toddler's eyeball is, at times, darn near impossible.  We struggled through it, and as I stated it cleared the infection up in less than a week.
